summary.p: 175 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: H. S. 176; Qurʾānic Text: unclear; 24 lines per page; Dimensions: 125 x 180mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 28: "84 H. S. 176. Aynı. Zerefşan kâğıda vessaleli parşömen. 180mm boy ve 125mm eninde 175 yaprak. Sahifede ince kûfi ile 57mm 24 satır. Tahminen V - VI. altı asırda yazılmıştır. Üzerinde Halife Ali’inin yazısı olduğu yazılıdır. Serlevha ve iki zahriyesi sonradan tahminen XI (XVII) asırda tezhip edilmiştir. Sure başları kûfi ile ile yaldrzla yazılmıştır. Miklepli ve sıvama yaldızlı vişneçürüğü deri cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "84 H. S. 176. Same. A vaṣṣālī parchment on zarafshan/saffron-colored paper. 175 leaves of 180 mm height and 125 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 24 lines measuring 57 mm. Probably copied during the 5th - 6th (11th -12th) century. It is mentioned that there is a writing by Caliph ʿAlī on it. The serlevha and two zahriyes are later decorated with illumination, estimated to be from the 11th (17th) century. The beginnings of the sūras are written in Kufic script with gold ink. Cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep) and gilding (sıvama yaldız).”
